title: Rural Solar Microgrids
description: Deploy solar microgrids to electrify 5 off-grid villages with reliable, clean power.
motivation: Energy access drives education, healthcare, and livelihoods.
problemStatement: Diesel generators are expensive and polluting; many homes lack evening lighting.
solution: Install community-scale solar + battery microgrids with prepaid meters and local maintenance.
thesis: Decentralized, community-owned clean energy delivers immediate quality-of-life improvements.

title: Telemedicine Kits for Clinics
description: Equip 20 rural clinics with telemedicine kits to connect patients to city specialists.
motivation: Specialist care is concentrated in cities; travel is costly and slow.
problemStatement: Patients in remote areas lack access to timely diagnostics and expert opinions.
solution: Deploy secure video, digital stethoscopes, and training; integrate with existing clinical flows.
thesis: Bridging the last-mile clinical gap reduces complications and saves lives.

title: Water Purification for Schools
description: Install low-maintenance water purification systems in 15 public schools.
motivation: Clean drinking water reduces absenteeism caused by water-borne illnesses.
problemStatement: Students often drink contaminated water due to lack of filtration.
solution: Deploy gravity-based ultrafiltration units with annual filter replacement and monitoring.
thesis: Simple, robust water tech leads to measurable education and health outcomes.

title: Open STEM Labs
description: Create open-access STEM labs with 3D printers and electronics for student projects.
motivation: Hands-on learning inspires future engineers and entrepreneurs.
problemStatement: Schools lack affordable prototyping tools and mentorship.
solution: Set up labs, train mentors, and run monthly build challenges with micro-grants.
thesis: Access + mentorship unlocks creativity and practical skills at scale.

title: Urban Tree Canopy Revival
description: Plant and maintain 2,000 native trees in heat-stressed neighborhoods.
motivation: Urban heat islands raise health risks and energy bills.
problemStatement: Tree cover has declined; communities face higher temperatures and poorer air quality.
solution: Community planting drives, watering schedules, and QR-coded stewardship tracking.
thesis: Nature-based cooling is cost-effective climate adaptation.

title: Makers-to-Market for Artisans
description: Train 500 artisans in product design, packaging, and e-commerce to boost income.
motivation: Skilled artisans struggle to reach markets and capture fair value.
problemStatement: Middlemen and poor branding limit margins and visibility.
solution: Workshops, brand kits, and an online marketplace; link to logistics partners.
thesis: Better market access turns craftsmanship into sustainable livelihoods.
